newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore April bank credit rises 13.1 pct on year.
newsitem.headline: Singapore April bank credit rises 13.1 pct on year.

text.p: Bank credit to non-bank customers (in billions of Singapore dollars):
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) said in its monthly report that bank credit grew at a slower pace in April at 13.1 percent, compared with 14.4 percent year-on-year in March.
The MAS said this was largely due to a decline in loan growth to non-bank financial institutions to 7.5 percent from 13.3 percent.
Lending to the construction and building sector also fell to 17.9 percent from 19.4 percent. But loans to the manufacturing sector grew to 7.9 percent against 5.9 percent in March.
Credit extended to the commerce sector and to professional and private individuals also went up slightly to 9.5 percent and 16.6 percent, respectively.
Bank credit to the transport sector grew at a slower rate at 24.7 percent in April while loans to other sectors grew by 8.9 percent.
